intro: Lawia ramosissima, commonly known as the hairy leaved rock fig, is a shrub native to arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It is characterized by its dense, branched structure and hairy leaves that help reduce water loss in dry environments. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by edible fig-like fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and limited rainfall. Due to its resilience, it is often used in xeriscaping and for erosion control in arid landscapes.
